data: ED/HAU Diabetic Ketoacidosis (DKA) Adult 19 Years and Older - Initial Management VGH
q1h, for 6 hour, then notify provider to reassess
q1h, for 12 hour, then notify provider to reassess
Notify provider if capillary blood glucose falls below 10 mmol/L
Goal is to maintain insulin regular human infusion until ketosis resolves and maintain serum potassium 4 to 5 mmol/L
Goal is to maintain insulin regular human infusion until ketosis resolves and maintain serum potassium 4 to 5 mmol/L
Refer to Diabetic Ketoacidosis Algorithm and Guideline
Discontinue all previous potassium chloride and insulin orders
DKA Solution 1 (Fluid Replacement and Maintenance), DKA Solution 2 (Glucose and / or Potassium Replacement) and DKA Solution 3 (Insulin Infusion) to be infused concurrently
Bolus Fluids, if no bolus required, refer to maintenance fluids
2,000 mL, IV, once, administer over: 1 hour, drug form: bag, first dose: NOW
1,000 mL, IV, once, administer over: 1 hour, drug form: bag, first dose: NOW
500 mL, IV, once, administer over: 1 hour, drug form: bag, first dose: NOW

500 mL, IV, once, administer over: 1 hour, drug form: bag, first dose: NOW
Maintenance fluids to be given after bolus is completed
order rate: 75 mL/h, IV, order duration: 12 hour, drug form: bag
order rate: 100 mL/h, IV, order duration: 12 hour, drug form: bag
order rate: 125 mL/h, IV, order duration: 12 hour, drug form: bag

DKA Solution 2 (Glucose AND / OR Potassium Replacement)

For DKA Solution 2, all the following solutions are pre-selected to allow nursing titration (based on glucose and/or potassium replacement). Refer to evidence link for potassium replacement guidance. Provider to select same rate for all six DKA Solution 2 fluids
If capillary blood glucose is greater than 14 mmol/L
order rate: 100 mL/h, IV, drug form: bag
order rate: 75 mL/h, IV, drug form: bag

order rate: 100 mL/h, IV, drug form: bag

Initial rate of insulin regular continuous infusion is usually 0.1 unit/kg/h
insulin regular continuous infusion (1 unit/mL) in NS standard
20 mmol, IV, q1h, PRN hypokalemia, administer over: 1 hour, drug form: bag
Baseline laboratory evaluation (if not already done)
Liver Panel (Bilirubin, ALP, Alb, ALT, GGT)
Venous Blood, Urgent, Collection: T;N, once
Urinalysis Macroscopic (dipstick) with Microscopic if indicated
Urine, Midstream, Urgent, Collection: T;N, once
Urine, Midstream, Urgent, Collection: T;N, once
Basic Metabolic Panel (Lytes, Urea, Creat, Gluc)
Blood, Urgent, Collection: T;N, q2h interval for 12 hour
Blood, Urgent, Collection: T;N, q4h interval for 12 hour
Blood, Urgent, Collection: T;N, q2h interval for 12 hour
Blood, Urgent, Collection: T;N, qdaily for 2 day
Urgent, Reason: Other (please specify), diabetic ketoacidosis
